com.algolia.search.saas

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.algolia.search.saas.Query

  • public class Query
extends java.lang.Object

    Describes all parameters of a search query.

    There are two ways to access parameters:

    1. Using the high-level, typed properties for individual parameters (recommended).
    2. Using the low-level, untyped getter (get()) and setter (set()) or the subscript operator. Use this approach if the parameter you wish to set is not supported by this class.

      • setAdvancedSyntax

        public Query setAdvancedSyntax(java.lang.Boolean enabled)

        Enable the advanced query syntax. Defaults to false. - Phrase query: a phrase query defines a particular sequence of terms. A phrase query is build by Algolia’s query parser for words surrounded by “. For example, ”search engine" will retrieve records having search next to engine only. Typo-tolerance is disabled on phrase queries. - Prohibit operator: The prohibit operator excludes records that contain the term after the - symbol. For example search -engine will retrieve records containing search but not engine.

      • getAdvancedSyntax

        public java.lang.Boolean getAdvancedSyntax()

      • setAllowTyposOnNumericTokens

        public Query setAllowTyposOnNumericTokens(java.lang.Boolean enabled)
        Parameters:
        enabled - If set to false, disable typo-tolerance on numeric tokens. Default to true.

      • setDistinct

        public Query setDistinct(java.lang.Integer nbHitsToKeep)

        This feature is similar to the distinct just before but instead of keeping the best value per value of attributeForDistinct, it allows to keep N values.

        Parameters:
        nbHitsToKeep - Specify the maximum number of hits to keep for each distinct value

      • getDistinct

        public java.lang.Integer getDistinct()

      • setFacets

        public Query setFacets(java.lang.String... facets)

        List of object attributes that you want to use for faceting. Only attributes that have been added in attributesForFaceting index setting can be used in this parameter. You can also use * to perform faceting on all attributes specified in attributesForFaceting.

      • getFacets

        public java.lang.String[] getFacets()

      • setIgnorePlurals

        public Query setIgnorePlurals(java.lang.Boolean enabled)

        If set to true, plural won’t be considered as a typo (for example car/cars will be considered as equals). Default to false.

      • getIgnorePlurals

        public java.lang.Boolean getIgnorePlurals()

      • setInsideBoundingBox

        public Query setInsideBoundingBox(Query.GeoRect... boxes)

        Search for entries inside a given area defined by the two extreme points of a rectangle. At indexing, geoloc of an object should be set with _geoloc attribute containing lat and lng attributes (for example {"_geoloc“:{”lat“:48.853409, ”lng":2.348800}})

        You can use several bounding boxes (OR) by calling this method several times.

      • getInsideBoundingBox

        public Query.GeoRect[] getInsideBoundingBox()

      • setInsidePolygon

        public Query setInsidePolygon(Query.LatLng... points)

        Add a point to the polygon of geo-search (requires a minimum of three points to define a valid polygon) At indexing, you should specify geoloc of an object with the _geoloc attribute (in the form "_geoloc“:{”lat“:48.853409, ”lng“:2.348800} or ”_geoloc":[{“lat”:48.853409, “lng”:2.348800},{“lat”:48.547456, “lng”:2.972075}] if you have several geo-locations in your record).

      • getInsidePolygon

        public Query.LatLng[] getInsidePolygon()

      • setRemoveStopWords

        public Query setRemoveStopWords(java.lang.Object removeStopWords)
                         throws AlgoliaException

        Enable the removal of stop words, disabled by default. In most use-cases, we dont recommend enabling this option.

        Parameters:
        removeStopWords - Boolean: enable or disable all 41 supported languages, String: comma separated list of languages you have in your record (using language iso code).
        Throws:
        AlgoliaException

      • getRemoveStopWords

        public java.lang.Object getRemoveStopWords()

      • setRemoveWordsIfNoResults

        public Query setRemoveWordsIfNoResults(Query.RemoveWordsIfNoResults type)

        Select the strategy to adopt when a query does not return any result.

      • getRemoveWordsIfNoResults

      • setReplaceSynonymsInHighlight

        public Query setReplaceSynonymsInHighlight(java.lang.Boolean enabled)
        Parameters:
        enabled - If set to false, words matched via synonyms expansion will not be replaced by the matched synonym in highlight result. Default to true.

      • getReplaceSynonymsInHighlight

        public java.lang.Boolean getReplaceSynonymsInHighlight()

      • setRestrictSearchableAttributes

        public Query setRestrictSearchableAttributes(java.lang.String... attributes)

        List of object attributes you want to use for textual search (must be a subset of the attributesToIndex index setting). Attributes are separated with a comma (for example @“name,address”). You can also use a JSON string array encoding (for example encodeURIComponent(“["name","address"]”)). By default, all attributes specified in attributesToIndex settings are used to search.

      • getRestrictSearchableAttributes

        public java.lang.String[] getRestrictSearchableAttributes()

      • setSnippetEllipsisText

        public Query setSnippetEllipsisText(java.lang.String snippetEllipsisText)

        Specify the string that is used as an ellipsis indicator when a snippet is truncated (defaults to the empty string).

      • getSnippetEllipsisText

        public java.lang.String getSnippetEllipsisText()

      • setSynonyms

        public Query setSynonyms(java.lang.Boolean enabled)
        Parameters:
        enabled - If set to false, this query will not use synonyms defined in configuration. Default to true.

      • parseLatLng

        public static Query.LatLng parseLatLng(java.lang.String value)

        Parse a LatLng from its String equivalent.

        Parameters:
        value - a String containing latitude/longitude.
        Returns:
        a LatLng object describing the given value.

      • set

        public Query set(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.Object value)

        Set a parameter in an untyped fashion. This low-level accessor is intended to access parameters that this client does not yet support.

        Parameters:
        name - The parameter’s name.
        value - The parameter’s value, or null to remove it. It will first be converted to a String by the toString() method.
        Returns:
        This instance (used to chain calls).

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(java.lang.String name)

        Get a parameter in an untyped fashion.

        Parameters:
        name - The parameter’s name.
        Returns:
        The parameter’s value, or null if a parameter with the specified name does not exist.
